text: He's not even feeling guilty about it, Todd is just a fatalist.

text: Your 13 lames should show you WHY no one had commented that yet.

text: Commentated is not a word.

text: define "word".

text: that depends on what your definition of is is.

text: Wow, commentated is totally a word. I suck.

name: greenkoolayd
text: look, mr clinton, you dont have to be a dick about terms...

name: cpnglxynchos
text: tell my secretary that.

name: sargasm
text: Todd killed his own friend with his own van!

name: max
text: It's ok, it's not like a he killed a real guy. Just a squirrel.

name: sidecar
text: Are you some kinda jerk or what?

name: closefriend
text: And he didn't even have it coming like Ricky Nihoha.

name: swarm_of_bears
text: I love the song, but I don't know how the song fits in with the Todd character we end up seeing later in the series. Then again, maybe we just don't get the chance to see Todd's more sensitive side all that often.

name: spectre
text: Well, he hasn't killed any friends lately. That kind of thing does tend to bring out your more meditative side. Trust me on this. I know.

name: differentdog
text: todd is left-handed, ambidextrous, or uninterested

name: trevor
text: I sort of imagine this song going a little like Subterranean Homesick Blues

name: em2
text:
Don't follow leaders
Watch the frikkin' parkin' meters!

name: tenshanhan
text: What's funny is, I know lots of people, actual human people, who will most likely die one of these ways eventually.

name: pitseleh
text: I'm pretty sure that Todd was greatly influenced by the musical stylings of William Shatner.

name: squi
text: I was surprised when nobody used these lyrics in the "Dude & Catastrophe" week of Songfight.

name: relaxing
text:
see you at the crossroads,
so you won't be lonely

and i'm gonna miss ev'rybody...

name: wharfrat
text: brutal

name: joamiq
text: For some reason I imagine this one sung to the tune of "Fake Empire" by the National, even though I don't think that's exactly what Todd was going for.

name: rowboat
text:
Wow! I went to lame you but then saw that I already had! Probably, like, a year ago!

Nothing personal, man. But really, why even say a thing?

name: gitarooman
text: what the fuck is your problem? you got something against the national? have a a lame, and joamiq have a chubby. if you sing the lyrics to that tune it goes together.

name: rowboat
text: Can we be serious buds for real? Your opinions and comments are among the best I've ever been exposed to. Gimme a call (314-239-4591) and let's talk about cool bands like The National and Death Cab and stuff. I've been wrong for too long. I need you in my life.

name: history
text: I am ridiculously tempted to dial this number and see what happens.  Is it an Imo's?  Is that the best I can hope for it to be?

name: rowboat
text:
Dang! Nice call on the area code/local business tip.

That was actually my cell phone number at the time. Must've been drunk.

name: i_love_kate
text:
Rowboat, are you a Dick?

(Also, you commented that seventeen hours ago? Are we rereading the archives at the same time? Are... are we on this adventure together? )

name: rowboat
text:
No, but I play one on assetbar.

(Also, yes, we apparently are. Hold on tight. I hear the fifth time through is the most extreme.)

name: i_love_kate
text:
Dude, I think this is actually my fifth time as well. EXTREEEEEEEME

EXTREEEEEEEEEEEEEME

As a person, or as a character?

text:

There are many ways to go

Some are fast, some are slow

Some guys go by their own hand
Em Am Dm Em C Am
Some get hit by their friend's van.

text: Todd is a little Tom Waits

text:
Oh, I meant just in general. Keep up the awesome work, I think I meant.

My typing is a dog's typing.
